description.raw:
Upgrade to qt5. This is a revival of pull request #2353. 

New changes in addition to the ones in pull request #2353 are:

* fix qt5 + ogre on high dpi displays, i.e. apple retina displays. Requires this [ogre1.9 homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb)

* fix building examples and plugins

* Updated QTestFixture and ServerFixture to clean up rendering after each test

Known issues:

* deletion of the ogre 1.9 root object fails on OSX. Added a workaround to detach render window before destruction.

* This is a tear down issue with qt5 + ogre which cause some gui tests to fail. The tests pass when run individually but fail if run in sequence. I was able to work around some of them by rearranging the test order. 

* There's a weird problem with qt5 + ogre 1.9 on osx that causes gazebo to crash when launching a world with many ogre manual objects (e.g. simple shapes) and no lights in the scene. Could be related to [this forum post](http://www.ogre3d.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=78306). Using a separate box mesh for SelectionObj's and/or adding a light source seem to make things work but exact cause of the problem is still unknown.

Jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/868/) - The 3 plugin test failures should be fixed by updating jenkins homebrew release-tools to find Qt5 properly. 2 GUI test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.

[xenial](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia_test/31/) - 2 test failures due to the second bullet point in the list of known issues.


TODO:

* Make qwt a required dependency instead of optional

New changes in addition to the ones in pull request #2353 are:

  • There's a weird problem with qt5 + ogre 1.9 on osx that causes gazebo to crash when launching a world with many ogre manual objects (e.g. simple shapes) and no lights in the scene. Could be related to this forum post. Using a separate box mesh for SelectionObj's and/or adding a light source seem to make things work but exact cause of the problem is still unknown.

  • Make qwt a required dependency instead of optional
